events.originalText: Suicide bombers blew up the British consulate and the headquarters of HSBC Bank in Istanbul, killing 31 people, including consul general Roger Short and actor Kerem Yılmazer.
events.subtitle: 2003 Istanbul bombings
events.headline: Suicide bombers attack British consulate and HSBC Bank in Istanbul, killing 31

events.originalText: In accordance with the Lusaka Protocol, the Angolan government signed a ceasefire with UNITA rebels in a failed attempt to end the Angolan Civil War.
events.subtitle: Lusaka Protocol
events.headline: Angolan government signs ceasefire with UNITA rebels in failed attempt to end Civil War

events.originalText: First Nagorno-Karabakh War: An Azerbaijani military helicopter carrying a peacekeeping mission team was shot down in Nagorno-Karabakh, disrupting ongoing peace talks.
events.subtitle: First Nagorno-Karabakh War
events.headline: Azerbaijani military helicopter shot down in Nagorno-Karabakh during peacekeeping mission

events.originalText: Andrei Chikatilo, one of the Soviet Union's most prolific serial killers, was arrested in Novocherkassk.
events.subtitle: Andrei Chikatilo
events.headline: Soviet serial killer Andrei Chikatilo arrested in Novocherkassk

events.originalText: A group of armed insurgents attacked and took over the Masjid al-Haram in Mecca, declaring that one of their leaders was the Mahdi, the prophesied redeemer of Islam.
events.subtitle: Grand Mosque seizure
events.headline: Insurgents take over Masjid al-Haram in Mecca, declaring leader as Mahdi

events.originalText: A group of Native American activists began a 19-month occupation of Alcatraz Island in San Francisco Bay.
events.subtitle: Native Americans in the United States
events.headline: Native American activists occupy Alcatraz Island in San Francisco Bay

events.originalText: Princess Elizabeth, daughter of King George VI, married Lieutenant Philip Mountbatten, who was given the title Duke of Edinburgh.
events.subtitle: Elizabeth II
events.headline: Princess Elizabeth marries Lieutenant Philip Mountbatten, becoming Duke of Edinburgh

events.originalText: The Nuremberg trials (defendants pictured) of 24 leading Nazis involved in the Holocaust and various war crimes during World War II began in Nuremberg, Germany.
events.subtitle: Nuremberg trials
events.headline: Nuremberg trials of leading Nazis involved in Holocaust begin in Germany

events.originalText: First World War: The Battle of Cambrai began with British forces having initial success over Germany's Hindenburg Line.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: Battle of Cambrai starts with British forces gaining initial success over Hindenburg Line

events.originalText: While discussing how to promote the newspaper L'Auto, sports journalist Géo Lefèvre came up with the idea of holding a cycling race that later became known as the Tour de France.
events.subtitle: L'Équipe
events.headline: Tour de France cycling race idea proposed by sports journalist Géo Lefèvre

events.originalText: Anglo-French blockade of the Río de la Plata: The Argentine Confederation was defeated in the Battle of Vuelta de Obligado, but the losses ultimately made the United Kingdom and France give up the blockade.
events.subtitle: Anglo-French blockade of the Río de la Plata
events.headline: Anglo-French blockade defeated in Battle of Vuelta de Obligado

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: The Battle of Fort Lee saw the invasion of New Jersey by British and Hessian forces and the subsequent general retreat of the Continental Army.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: British and Hessian forces invade New Jersey in Battle of Fort Lee

events.originalText: War of Jenkins' Ear: A British naval force arrived at the settlement of Portobello in the Spanish Main, capturing it the next day.
events.subtitle: War of Jenkins' Ear
events.headline: British naval force captures Portobello in War of Jenkins' Ear

events.originalText: Diocletian (bust pictured) became Roman emperor, eventually establishing reforms that ended the Crisis of the Third Century.
events.subtitle: Diocletian
events.headline: Diocletian becomes Roman emperor, ending Crisis of the Third Century reforms
